body.text: City generator is a tool for generating urban designs automatically. This allows for the exploration of thousands of potential design options for a site that can be evaluated by a series of analysis tools.

body.caption: Attributes and geometry are passed through the inheritance tree from object to object.

body.text: The model is comprised of object classes that represent different elements in an urban plan. Each object passes particular attributes and geometry to their child objects creating what is a model for procedural generation that is reactive.

body.caption: A tool panel in Grasshopper allows for easy object instantiation and method access.

body.text: While the ultimate goal was to move this system to a cloud computing platform utilizing Rhino Compute, the first step was to build it in the Rhino/Grasshopper environment with RhinoCommon. The result of this process was a grasshopper plugun that pushed custom classes between components.

body.caption: A robust offsetting algorithm ensures quality results regardless of geometry.
The street network is a graph that can having routing operations performed on it like walksheds.
A network graph is iterated over to make blocks, which can then be offset by parent street class.
A single building class can represent many building types depending on the parameters used.
Dynamic building types can be deployed across blocks.
These images represent each of the metrics used to analyze urban options.
